poem:
**In the Ring of Shadows**

In the dim arena,  
Wang, like an ancient tree,  
bears the weight of struggle.  
Muscles tense with stories untold,  
silver threads gleaming,  
as roots in moonlight.  
He grasps, knowing  
the dance of force and fall,  
seeking stars in the dust  
and the silence  
beyond cheers,  
beyond shadows.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "China’s pro-wrestlers search for a star to bring the sport out of the shadows Rising from the ground with 73kg of writhing muscle on his shoulders, Wang Tao grimaced. The man whose legs were wrapped around his head was not giving up, pulling at Wang’s silver-tipped hair, dyed especially for the occasion. But Wang knew what he had to do. Reaching up with one arm, he grasped his opponent’s neck, and pulled forwards, flinging him". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
